explanation: Agent A is correct. In the supplied project LFS_UNLOCK(cfg) is defined as ((void)cfg), so the statement LFS_UNLOCK(lfs->cfg); in lfs_file_read() is an executed expression statement that has no observable effect (it only evaluates and discards lfs->cfg). Removing that statement would not change program behaviour (there are no side-effects from evaluating the cfg member as shown), so it meets the definition of dead code in MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2. Caveat: if cfg were volatile or the macro expanded differently under other build configurations (i.e. a real unlock implementation), then the statement could have observable effects; however with the definitions you provided the report is correct.
